content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto border-4 border-sky-900 rounded-lg

content.text:
En la sección de preguntas medianas, se requiere un conocimiento más a fondo del uso del lenguaje, comprensión lectora y de análisis que va más allá del entendimiento de palabras y tiempos verbales simples y la capacidad de relacionar las palabras claves con sus correspondientes respuestas. En este caso, es necesario entender los distintos tiempos verbales, tanto simples como compuestos, así como el correcto uso de conectores y verbos modales (o verbos auxiliares) para ser capaz de identificar errores en oraciones y pequeños textos.
Esto aplica en todas las preguntas de desarrollo mediano, donde el alumno ya sabe identificar qué es lo que gramaticalmente completa mejor una idea. En algunos casos se utilizará la comprensión de idea general y en otros tantos la información de palabras claves y la habilidad de “leer entre líneas”.

wv8V

content.text: From questions 13-18 choose the alternative that is the closest in meaning to the provided sentences.

content.class: bg-slate-100 rounded p-3 my-2 max-w-3xl mx-auto

content.textual:
Seth is a good friend. He is regularly surrounded by people. Seth has a pleasant personality.
Seth has got a lot of friends because of his pleasant personality and the people’s opinion.
Seth is a pleasant, good friend who is always surrounded by people.
Seth has got a pleasant personality and he has been considered to be a good friend. That has given him the opportunity to be surrounded by people.
Seth is regularly a good friend, surrounded by people. He rarely has a pleasant personality.
c

Nate has been learning how to program computers for the last couple of years. He might become a technician in the future.
Nate is the best a computer because he has been learning about them for two years.
Nate has been learning about programming computers for about two years and there is highly possible he becomes a technician.
Nate will surely become a technician in the future since he has been studying computers for a couple of years.
If Nate keeps on learning about programming, he will rarely become a technician.
b

Danna is a great student. She is looking for a scholarship. Danna wants to study abroad.
If Danna was a better student, she will surely get a lot of scholarships.
Danna will surely study abroad because she is a great student who got a scholarship.
Danna will not study abroad if she gets a scholarship for being a great student.
Danna has the intention of studying in another country. Therefore, she has been looking for a scholarship which she will probably get since she is a great student.
d

Jerry is confused. Jerry does not understand nor like Math. Jerry has to take extra Math lessons.
Jerry will take extra Geography lessons because he does not like nor understand the subject.
Jerry is not obligated to take extra Math lessons because he does not like nor understand the subject.
Jerry should take extra Math lessons because he does not like nor understand the subject. He’s confused about it.
Jerry is eager to take extra Math lessons because he  likes nor understand the subject.
c

Elaine has been singing since she was a little kid. She wants to start a band and play at parties.
Elaine has a great, big, successful band.
Elaine will probably start a band soon so they can play at parties together.
Elaine will surely start a band soon so they can play at carnivals.
Elaine started a band when she was a kid. They play at parties together.
b

Christina is an amazing skater. Christina has an attitude problem. Christina’s trainer has a difficult time with her.
Christina has a problem with her trainer because of her attitude. Still, she is an average skater.
Christina is good at skating but she has a problem with her trainer.
Christina and her trainer have problems because of her attitude. She is the best skater.
Christina’s trainer has a problem with her because of her attitude. Still, she is a skillful skater.
d
